Dear Parents and Community Members:
I hope this message finds you and your families safe and well. Today, Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker
announced that remote learning in...
Letter to our Students, Families and Community
We’re thrilled to announce Pinckneyville Community High School District’s new app! It’s everything PCHS, in your pocket.With the new app, you can access sports scores,...
Love you all! Stay Panther Strong!!

Out today spreading a little love & cheer for the Seniors! Huge THANK YOU to Trish Hirte and the generous donation of a community member to cover the cost of the signs! We didn't make to all the houses today, but will be back out tomorrow! #PantherNation #Class of 2020

Sunday March 29... PCHS FAMILIES - Mr. Wilson and I are participating in an ISBE webinar addressing the shift to the upcoming “Remote Learning Days”. We will be working with our teachers to develop our community solution to learning. We appreciate you all and your patience as we work through the unknowns. #PantherNation #BetterTogether

PCHS is going to be hosting a virtual spirit week! Next week, March 30th- April 3rd, we will be posting a daily challenge to our Facebook page. Students can participate by taking a photo and posting it in the comments of the post. Students who participate will get their names put into a hat to be drawn for a prize each day. The post will be up around 10:00 am and students have until 3:00 pm to share their photo before a name is drawn. We can’t wait to see our students and teachers sharing their school spirit! Below are the virtual spirit week daily challenges:
Movie Monday: Post a picture of a movie you have watched during the lockdown.
Take Care Tuesday: Show us your self-care by posting a picture. Yoga, reading, skincare, cleaning, etc. what have you done to better yourself?
Workout Wednesday: Post a picture of your workout gear or routine during the lockdown.
Thank You Thursday: post what you're thankful for during this time at home.
Fan Friday: show your Panther spirit! Take a picture of yourself, or your family, showing panther pride!

Attention Seniors: Rend Lake College is now going to register for Fall 2020 via telephone/video chat appointments. The face to face appointments that were scheduled for April 15 & 16 have been cancelled. Check your PCHS emails for more information.
